intro: Monelasmum setigerum, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Monelasmum setigerum is notable for its ability to spread via rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
